comments.raw_text:
As of bug 451250 undoing the close tab of an expired form post will no longer trigger a POSTDATA warning, so the workaround in bug 378160 is unnecessary.

Steps to reproduce problem:
1. Submit a form that uses the POST method
2. Close the tab
3. Clear the cache (not necessary for some forms, such as bank logins)
4. Undo the tab close

Expected result: Error page because the page is no longer in the cache

Actual result: Browser tries to visit form result as a normal page

Note that the whitespace cleanup in the checkin for bug 378160 should stay!
comments.creator: neil@httl.net

comments.creator: philip.chee@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
I backed out bug 378160 locally but can't reproduce the STR in Comment 0
I mean I don't get this:
> Expected result: Error page because the page is no longer in the cache
I tried to clear cache via Tools->Clear Private Data and also via Preferences->Advanced->Cache
